extractFactDictList.question: What is the school leaving age in England?
extractFactDictList.sentence: England: You can leave school on the last Friday in June if you'll be 16 by the end of the summer holidays.

extractFactDictList.question: What are the options for individuals who leave school in England?
extractFactDictList.sentence: You must then do one of the following until you're 18: stay in full-time education, for example at a college; start an apprenticeship or traineeship; spend 20 hours or more a week working or volunteering, while in part-time education or training.

extractFactDictList.question: When can individuals leave school in Scotland if they turn 16 between 1 March and 30 September?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Scotland: If you turn 16 between 1 March and 30 September you can leave school after 31 May of that year.

extractFactDictList.question: When can individuals leave school in Scotland if they turn 16 between 1 October and the end of February?
extractFactDictList.sentence: If you turn 16 between 1 October and the end of February you can leave at the start of the Christmas holidays in that school year.

extractFactDictList.question: What is the school leaving age in Wales?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Wales: You can leave school on the last Friday in June, as long as you'll be 16 by the end of that school year's summer holidays.

extractFactDictList.question: When can individuals leave school in Northern Ireland if they turn 16 during the school year?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Northern Ireland: If you turn 16 during the school year (between 1 September and 1 July) you can leave school after 30 June.

extractFactDictList.question: When can individuals leave school in Northern Ireland if they turn 16 between 2 July and 31 August?
extractFactDictList.sentence: If you turn 16 between 2 July and 31 August you can't leave school until 30 June the following year.
